message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public double parseEqn(String str) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, "+-/*%", true);
    String first = st.nextToken();
    String op = st.nextToken();
    String second = st.nextToken();
    double ff = Double.parseDouble(first);
    double ss = Double.parseDouble(second);
    double answer;

    if (op.equals("+")) {
        answer = ff + ss;
    } else if (op.equals("-")) {
        answer = ff - ss;
    } else if (op.equals("/")) {
        answer = ff / ss;
    } else {
        answer = ff * ss;
    }

    return answer;
}
<<<explanation>>>: The error "Syntax error, insert "AssignmentOperator ArrayInitializer" to complete ArrayInitializerAssignement" means that there is a syntax error in your code. In your code, you have a syntax error in the line "else (op.equals("*")){". The correct syntax for an "else" statement is "else if" or just "else" without any condition.

To fix the error, you should change the line to "else if (op.equals("*")){". This will correctly check if the operator is "*", and execute the corresponding code block.

Additionally, your current code only handles expressions with one operator. If you want to handle expressions with multiple operators, you will need to modify your code to handle multiple tokens from the StringTokenizer. You can use a loop to iterate through the tokens and perform the operations accordingly.
